comments.body: not related?  Does this compile?  you clearly use io later, and never added strconv usage
why not make this a private struct?
In health code we have a last ditch effort to Atoi() the strval and see if it was a number stored as a string.  Do we want that here?
Honestly the StrInt thing should have a String() method and an Int() method. It just kills me to see this sort of code replicated everywhere.
I ended up adding the attempt to parse it before the loop, I'd argue that principle of least surprise says that a user expects: "80" to be treated as a number, rather than a port name.

@lavalamp re strint: What does String() return if the stored value is an
int?  What does Int() return if the stored value is a string?

On Thu, Sep 4, 2014 at 11:06 AM, Daniel Smith notifications@github.com
wrote:

> In pkg/kubelet/handlers.go:
> 
> > +
> > +// ResolvePort attempts to turn a IntOrString port reference into a concrete port number.
> > +// If portReference has an int value, it is treated as a literal, and simply returns that value.
> > +// If portReference is a string, an attempt is made to find a port with the same name in the container spec.
> > +// If a port with the same name is found, it's ContainerPort value is returned.  If no matching
> > +// port is found, an error is returned.
> > +func ResolvePort(portReference util.IntOrString, container *api.Container) (int, error) {
> > -   if portReference.Kind == util.IntstrInt {
> > -       return portReference.IntVal, nil
> > -   } else {
> > -       portName := portReference.StrVal
> > -       for _, portSpec := range container.Ports {
> > -           if portSpec.Name == portName {
> > -               return portSpec.ContainerPort, nil
> > -           }
> > -       }
> 
> Honestly the StrInt thing should have a String() method and an Int()
> method. It just kills me to see this sort of code replicated everywhere.
> 
> ##

> https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/pull/1156/files#r17131243
